name: DeviceRegistryEvents
description: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Azure Sentinel. This table contains Creation and modification of registry entries.

properties.name: ActionType
properties.description: Type of activity that triggered the event.

properties.name: AppGuardContainerId
properties.description: Identifier for the virtualized container used by Application Guard to isolate browser activity.

properties.name: DeviceId
properties.description: Unique identifier for the device in the service.

properties.name: DeviceName
properties.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the device.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessAccountDomain
properties.description: Domain of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessAccountName
properties.description: User name of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessAccountObjectId
properties.description: Azure AD object ID of the user account that ran the process responsible for the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessAccountSid
properties.description: Security Identifier (SID) of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessAccountUpn
properties.description: User principal name (UPN) of the account that ran the process responsible for the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessCommandLine
properties.description: Command line used to run the process that initiated the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessFileName
properties.description: Name of the process that initiated the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessFolderPath
properties.description: Folder containing the process (image file) that initiated the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessId
properties.description: Process ID (PID) of the process that initiated the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessIntegrityLevel
properties.description: Integrity level of the process that initiated the event. Windows assigns integrity levels to processes based on certain characteristics, such as if they were launched from an internet download. These integrity levels influence permissions to resources..

properties.name: InitiatingProcessMD5
properties.description: MD5 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessParentFileName
properties.description: Name of the parent process that spawned the process responsible for the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessParentId
properties.description: Process ID (PID) of the parent process that spawned the process responsible for the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessSHA1
properties.description: SHA-1 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessSHA256
properties.description: SHA-256 hash of the process (image file) that initiated the event. This field is usually not populated - use the SHA1 column when available..

properties.name: InitiatingProcessTokenElevation
properties.description: Token type indicating the presence or absence of User Access Control (UAC) privilege elevation applied to the process that initiated the event.

properties.name: MachineGroup
properties.description: Machine group of the machine. This group is used by role-based access control to determine access to the machine.

properties.name: PreviousRegistryKey
properties.description: Original registry key before it was modified.

properties.name: PreviousRegistryValueData
properties.description: Original data of the registry value before it was modified.

properties.name: PreviousRegistryValueName
properties.description: Original name of the registry value before it was modified.

properties.name: RegistryKey
properties.description: Registry key that the recorded action was applied to.

properties.name: RegistryValueData
properties.description: Data of the registry value that the recorded action was applied to.

properties.name: RegistryValueName
properties.description: Name of the registry value that the recorded action was applied to.

properties.name: RegistryValueType
properties.description: Data type, such as binary or string, of the registry value that the recorded action was applied to.

properties.name: ReportId
properties.description: Event identifier based on a repeating counter. To identify unique events, this column must be used in conjunction with the ComputerName and EventTime columns..

properties.name: TimeGenerated
properties.description: Date and time when the record was generated.

properties.name: Timestamp
properties.description: Date and time when the record was generated. This is identical to TimeGenerated and added for query portability from MDATP Advanced Hunting.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessParentCreationTime
properties.description: Date and time when the parent of the process responsible for the event was started.

properties.name: InitiatingProcessCreationTime
properties.description: Date and time when the process that initiated the event was started.
